title: Woodford saga 'shines spotlight' on manager fees, experts warn
text:
From the moment Neil Woodford slammed the door on his flagship Equity Income Fund, the once-feted fund manager has faced repeated calls to axe management fees for the thousands of savers with trapped nest eggs.

Mr Woodford's firm has been raking in around £65,000 a day from customers who trusted him with their money - meaning it has netted almost £8.7m since withdrawals were blocked.

But the manager stubbornly resisted calls from regulators, MPs and partner business Hargreaves Lansdown to stop charging the cash.

At the time, it was thought he might be hoping to store this money up and offer a discount to customers who stayed invested when the fund eventually reopened its doors.
